EventCount.description: EventCount JSON struct with count of matching events
EventCount.title: EventCount

EventDistinctQuery.description: EventDistinctQuery is the users' command to search our auth logs for distinct values of the specified field

end_time.description: optional query end time, UTC in RFC3339 format

field.description: field is what they wish to query on

service.description: service name to query. Known services: systems,radius,sso,directory,ldap,all

start_time.description: query start time, UTC in RFC3339 format

EventDistinctQuery.title: EventDistinctQuery

EventIntervalQuery.description: EventIntervalQuery is the users' command to search our auth logs for bucketed counts of values of the specified field

end_time.description: optional query end time, UTC in RFC3339 format

interval_value.description:
Interval Value. This specifies how many units you want to bucket the event counts by
optional

service.description: service name to query. Known services: systems,radius,sso,directory,ldap,all

start_time.description: query start time, UTC in RFC3339 format

timezone.description:
TimeZone. Specify the timezone in which the user is in
optional

EventIntervalQuery.title: EventIntervalQuery

EventQuery.description: EventQuery is the users' command to search our auth logs

end_time.description: optional query end time, UTC in RFC3339 format

fields.description: optional list of fields to return from query

limit.description: Max number of rows to return

search_after.description: Specific query to search after, see x-* response headers for next values

service.description: service name to query. Known services: systems,radius,sso,directory,ldap,all

sort.description: ASC or DESC order for timestamp

start_time.description: query start time, UTC in RFC3339 format

EventQuery.title: EventQuery

SearchTerm.description:
SearchTerm is the filter portion of the query
it contains only one of 'and' or 'or' conjunction maps
SearchTerm.title: SearchTerm

TermConjunction.description:
TermConjunction represents a conjunction (and/or)
NOTE: the validator limits what the operator can be, not the object
for future-proof-ness
and a list of sub-values
TermConjunction.title: TermConjunction

info.description:
# API Overview The purpose of this API is to query Jumpcloud Directory Insights events ## Directory Insights Directory Insights provides event logs, see activity happening in your directory, and monitor user authentications to the console, SSO apps, RADIUS, and LDAP. Directory Insights shines a light on audit trails leading up to critical events so you know the what, where, when, how, and who of your directory activities. Directory Events:** Logs on activity in the Portal, including admin changes in the directory and admin/user authentications to the Portal. SAML Events:** Logs on user authentications to SAML applications. RADIUS Events:** Logs on user authentications to RADIUS used for wifi and VPNs. MacOS, Windows and Linux Events**: Logs about user authentications to systems including agent related events on lockout, password changes, and File Disk Encryption key updates. LDAP Events**: Logs about user authentications to LDAP, including LDAP bind and search events types. MDM Events**: Logs about MDM command results. Directory Insights is available in our API, Powershell, and Activity Log. The API uses a single POST endpoint: ``` https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events ``` ## Data Retention Event logs are retained for 90 days beginning on March 14, 2020. Queries that exceed the retention period will only return valid results within the time window. New services released after March 14, 2020 will have a total of 90 days available after their release date. # Authentication & Authorization ## Authentication ### Access Your API Key To locate your API Key: 1. Log in to the [JumpCloud Admin Portal](https://console.jumpcloud.com/). 2. Go to the username drop down located in the top-right of the Portal. 3. Retrieve your API key from API Settings. ### API Key Considerations This API key is associated with the currently logged in administrator. Only administrator roles can access the API. Command runners will receive 403 error. Please keep this API key secret, as it grants full access to any data accessible via your JumpCloud admin account. You can also reset your API key in the same location in the JumpCloud Admin Portal. #### Recycling or Resetting Your API Key In order to revoke access with the current API key, simply reset your API key. This will render all calls using the previous API key inaccessible. ### Example Request (Mac and LINUX) ``` curl -X POST -H x-api-key:[YOUR_API_KEY_HERE]" -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"service": ["all"], "start_time": "2020-03-03T14:00:00Z"}' https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events ``` ### Example Request (Windows) For Windows we recommend creating a local .txt file to pass in the JSON POST body with the query parameters. ``` curl -X POST -H "x-api-key:[YOUR_API_KEY_HERE]" -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data @./filewithpostbody.txt "https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events" ``` In the example above create a file `filewithpostbody.txt` with the POST body and execute the command within the directory with the local file. See [how to create a POST body](#json-post-request-body) below. ``` { "service": ["all"], "start_time": "2020-03-03T00:00:00Z" } ``` ## Managed Service Providers Managed Service Providers can query client organizations by providing their API key in the header and a second header key "x-org-id" for the client org they administer. ### Example Request ``` curl -X POST -H "x-api-key:[YOUR_API_KEY_HERE]" -H "x-org-id:[ADMINISTERED_ORG_ID]" -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"service": ["all"], "start_time": "2020-03-03T14:00:00Z"}' https://api.jumpcloud.com/insights/directory/v1/events ``` # How to use the Directory Insights API ## JSON POST request body Queries are made by HTTP POST request to the apiâ€™s /events web context, using curl or Postman or wget or other HTTP client. The two required fields in the JSON body are ``` "service": [""] ``` and ``` "start_time": "" ``` Valid values for "service" are:
"all" Logs from all services.
"directory" Logs on activity in the Portal, including admin changes in the directory and admin/user authentications to the Portal.
"radius" Logs on user authentications to RADIUS used for wifi and VPNs.
"sso" Logs on user authentications to SAML applications.
"systems" Logs about user authentications to MacOS, Windows, and Linux systems including agent related events on lockout, password changes, and File Disk Encryption key updates.
"ldap" Logs about user authentications to LDAP, including LDAP bind and search events types.
"mdm" Logs about MDM command results.
If you specify an invalid or unknown value for "service", the system will respond with the list of supported values. Choo
info.title: Directory Insights API

post.description: Query the API for Directory Insights events

200.description: Array of Directory Insights events JSON objects
